basics.name: Mohsin Khan
basics.label: Cybersecurity Researcher
basics.summary: Cybersecurity researcher specializing in lightweight cryptography, blockchain-based access control, and secure embedded systems. Experienced in academic and industrial security projects with a focus on IoT and distributed trust architectures.

location.address: Department of Computer Science, UiT The Arctic University of Norway

work.name: Blackbuck Insight
work.summary: Built and maintained scalable data pipelines and analytics infrastructure for logistics and transport systems. Migrated systems to AWS and optimized performance and security.
highlights: Worked with AWS EC2, Lambda, and S3.
Led efforts in secure infrastructure migration.

volunteer.location: UiT The Arctic University of Norway
volunteer.summary: Organized workshops and guest lectures on embedded security and blockchain systems.
highlights: Delivered technical sessions on ChipWhisperer and access control.
Guided master's students on secure microcontroller programming.

education.institution: UiT The Arctic University of Norway

publications.name: A Comparative Analysis of Lightweight Hash Functions Using AVR ATXMega128 and ChipWhisperer
publications.summary: Benchmarked lightweight hash functions using ChipWhisperer and custom E-RANK metric for performance, memory, and energy evaluation on constrained devices.

publications.name: Software Benchmarking of NIST Lightweight Hash Function Finalists on Resource-Constrained AVR Platform via ChipWhisperer
publications.summary: Analyzed NIST finalists for lightweight hashing on AVR devices, evaluated using ChipWhisperer and E-RANK composite metric.

publications.name: Traffic Congestion Reduction and Accident Circumvention System via Incorporation of CAV and VANET
publications.summary: Designed an intelligent transportation model combining CAV and VANET systems for real-time accident avoidance and congestion detection.

references.name: Prof. Håvard Dagenborg
references.reference: Supervisor at UiT. Oversaw cryptographic benchmarking and secure access control research.

references.name: Prof. Dag Johansen
references.reference: Advisor on PhD committee. Collaborated on distributed trust frameworks and security architecture research.

projects.name: Distributed Trust Enforcement Architecture (DTEA)
projects.summary: A blockchain-based access control framework for IoT security using PoA and capability tokens.

projects.name: CryptoBench-RPi-Arduino_LWC
projects.summary: Benchmarking lightweight cryptographic primitives on embedded RPi/Arduino systems.
